events.name: Getting Started With Raspberry Pi
events.description:
Talk 1: Getting Started with Raspberry Pi with Yeo Kheng Meng

Internet-of-things (IoT) are the rage this days. Many makers and companies are building projects that revolve around tiny computers accomplishing small tasks that together help to acheive goals in the bigger picture.

Being small, affordable and with plenty of community support, the tiny yet powerful Raspberry Pi is one of the key drivers in this space amongst both hobbyists and power-users alike.

Find out how to get started from scratch with the Raspberry Pi. Topics covered will include what to purchase, setting up and basic Python programming to interact with the outside world.

Kheng Meng is a hardware engineer at Algo Access, a startup providing IoT and tech solutions to the optometry industry.

Talk 2: Levelling Up - Playing Retro Video Games with the Raspberry Pi and Kenneth Yong

As someone who grew up playing more video games than what is considered healthy, Kenneth was delighted to find out that a relative beginner in electronics could learn how to use the Raspberry Pi while building the video game machine of his dreams.

Listen to his journey and learn how this practical application of the Raspberry Pi came about

Kenneth is a business graduate who has spent the last 2 years in the 3D printing industry before venturing into the world of freelance Making.

Register Here
